message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques for document-level understanding. Specifically, it focuses on sequential sentence classification, which is a subfield of text classification. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses pretrained language models, which are a popular technique in deep learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. Additionally, the paper deals with contextual dependencies and sentence representations, which are relevant to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper achieves state-of-the-art results, which is a common goal in cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
